intro: Epilobium tenuipes, commonly known as slender willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, often rocky habitats such as stream banks and meadows. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are usually less than 2 inches in length. Its small, pink to purple flowers appear in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. Epilobium tenuipes is often found in alpine or subalpine regions, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions.
